transcript: not considering this junc- tion advisable, meant, among other arguments in support of his view, to show the Austrian general the wretched state in which the troops arrived from Russia. With this object he in- tended to meet the regiment; so the worse the condition it was in, the better pleased the com- mander in chief would be. Though the aide- de-camp did not know these circumstances, he nevertheless delivered the definite order that the men should be in their greatcoats and in marching or
